intro: Thelypodium longirostre, commonly known as the long-beaked thelypodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy texture. Thelypodium longirostre is native to parts of Europe and Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
